text: Aidan Flanagan (born 1974) is an Irish retired hurler who played as a corner- forward for the Tipperary senior hurling team. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !rowspan="2"|Team !rowspan="2"|Year !colspan="3"|National League !colspan="2"|Munster !colspan="2"|All-Ireland !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Score!!Apps!!Score!!Apps!!Score!!Apps!!Score |- |rowspan="1"|Tipperary |1997 |rowspan="1"|Division 1 |8||1-30||1||0-00||1||1-01||10||2-31 |- !colspan="3"|Total |8||1-30||1||0-00||1||1-01||10||2-31 |} ==Honours== ;Boherlahen-Dualla *Tipperary Senior Hurling Championship (1): 1996 ;Tipperary *All-Ireland Under-21 Hurling Championship (1): 1995 *Munster Under-21 Hurling Championship (1): 1995 Fitzgibbon Cup with W.I.T. 1995 ==References== ==External links== * Aidan Flanagan profile at the Tipp GAA Archives website Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Boherlahan-Dualla hurlers Category:Tipperary inter-county hurlers Category:Garda Síochána officers
title: Aidan Flanagan
